node.title: Canada Moves To End Ban On Gay Men Donating Blood After 30 Years
node.description: The outright lifetime ban was implemented in 1992 after thousands of Canadians became infected with HIV after being exposed to contaminated blood products.

node.title: Science Teacher John Alvarez Fired for Repeated Refusal to Wear Face Mask
node.description: A school board in Broward County in Florida voted to fire teacher John Alvarez for refusing to wear a mask in school as well as to his own suspension hearing.

node.title: Why Lia Thomas, Transgender Swimmer, is Allowed to Compete in Women's Events
node.description: Thomas is allowed to compete and is following the rules of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA).

node.title: Kids, Ages 9 and 6, Were Possibly Targeted in Deadly Shooting Along With Man: Police
node.description: Police said two armed suspects had approached the vehicle and opened fire "without any apparent warning or provocation" before a third suspect drove them away.

node.title: Newly Approved Eye Drops Could Replace Reading Glasses for 128 Million Americans
node.description: If presbyopia is left uncorrected, a person can experience headaches and eye strain could become more routine, according to ophthalmologists.

node.title: School Board Member Punched in Face During Meeting to Weigh Changing High School Mascot
node.description: The school's mascot was changed from the Tomahawks to the Guardians, but some petitioners say they didn't get enough input because of the pandemic.

node.title: Derek Chauvin pleads guilty ro depriving George Floyd's civil rights during arrest
node.description: The former Minneapolis police officer enters a federal court plea which will likely extend his period in prison beyond 25 years.

node.title: COVID vaccines don't need to be changed for Omicron for now, says Fauci
node.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci spoke Wednesday at a White House briefing on COVID-19.

node.title: Stone Soup for the Soul, and Other Recipes
node.description: Gabrielle Hamilton’s final column for The New York Times Magazine, and new recipes from Jerelle Guy, Yewande Komolafe, and Yotam Ottolenghi.

node.title: Rita Moreno and Ariana DeBose: From One Anita to Another
node.description: The two actresses explain what the new “West Side Story” gets right, what the original lacked and why playing the role they’re both known for is so gut-wrenching.

node.title: Review: In ‘Station Eleven,’ the World Ends, Beautifully
node.description: Don’t let the pandemic premise chase you off. This is the most uplifting post-apocalyptic show you’re likely to see.

node.title: New York University is the latest school to cancel events over a Covid surge.
node.description: The university said it was scrapping all “nonessential” gatherings on and off its Manhattan campus, where 99 percent of students are vaccinated.

node.title: France Refused to Repatriate a Sick Woman Who Joined the Islamic State. She Died.
node.description: A Frenchwoman died of health complications in a detention camp in Syria on Tuesday, her lawyer said. She had repeatedly asked to be repatriated to treat severe diabetes.

node.title: Mountains of Waste Left by Kentucky Tornadoes May Pose Hazards 'Damaging to Human Health'
node.description: AccuWeather Chief Meteorologist Jonathan Porter said that "additional injuries and sometimes fatalities" are often seen in the aftermath of a storm like this.

node.title: This Is What Times Square Would Look Like Without Any Adverts
node.description: The iconic Times Square is a major tourist attraction in New York, but one artist has revealed how different it could look.

node.title: 11 People Died on Same Street, 7 of them Children, in Kentucky Tornado
node.description: The tornado tore through some homes in a Bowling Green, Kentucky, neighborhood so thoroughly that it exposed the earth underneath the floors.

node.title: Derek Chauvin pleads guilty in federal civil rights case
node.description: The change of plea hearing took place Wednesday in St. Paul, Minnesota.

node.title: How companies like Puff Bar have avoided FDA regulation
node.description: The Food and Drug Administration banned flavored e-cigarettes, like Juul, citing their popularity among teens.

node.title: Keechant Sewell will become first woman to lead NYPD
node.description: The NYPD will be led by a woman for the first time in its 176-year history.

node.title: Review: First the Party, Then the Crash, in a ‘Cabaret’ Revival
node.description: A London production starring Eddie Redmayne pulls the audience into a hedonistic milieu. Then things get dark.

node.title: ‘Vivian Maier Developed,’ an Intimate Biography of a Very Private Photographer
node.description: Ann Marks’s biography is a fascinating overview of the “photographer nanny” whose work has kept critics, lawyers and scholars busy since it was discovered after her death in 2009.

node.title: A Mental Health Crisis Among the Young
node.description: A health professional and an author/filmmaker write that we are failing our youths. Also: Memo to Democrats; military spending; moving away from coal.

node.title: Kroger, the U.S. grocery giant, eliminates paid Covid-19 leave for unvaccinated workers.
node.description: The company said some unvaccinated employees in its health plans would be charged $50 a month. It’s unclear how many of the company’s nearly 500,000 employees are vaccinated.

node.title: Biden Will Tour Kentucky Storm Damage
node.description: President Biden will visit another disaster area in an effort to offer comfort to victims and highlight the federal government’s response.

node.title: Putin, Xi Agree NATO Should Not Expand East, Plan to Meet During 2022 Beijing Olympics
node.description: The two leaders met on a video conference to discuss their nations' relationships with each other.

node.title: Hundreds Trapped on Roof, Fifth-Floor Balcony After Fire Breaks Out in Skyscraper
node.description: A fire broke out in the Hong Kong World Trade Center. People said the fire alarms didn't go off as several floors' alarms weren't working due to construction.

node.title: Poland Limits How Many Unvaccinated People Can Be Inside Restaurants, Theaters at One Time
node.description: Reporting its highest number of COVID deaths since April, Poland rolled out a series of restrictions limiting capacities at public venues.

node.title: Vadim Krasikov Sentenced to Life in Prison by German Court for Kremlin-Ordered Killing
node.description: The court said Vadim Krasikov was provided a false identity, fake passport and resources to complete the brazen killing in broad daylight.

node.title: You Can Now Get Paid $65 an Hour to Watch DIY TikTok Hacks
node.description: A company is looking to hire a "TikTok hack reviewer" where they will be paid for simply finding the best DIY tips and tricks on the network.

node.title: Derek Chauvin Pleads Guilty to Violating Civil Rights of George Floyd and 14-Year-Old Boy
node.description: Floyd's family members were in attendance as Chauvin changed his federal plea from not guilty to guilty.
